rsbNotes.title: Pr 9
rsbNotes.text: 9:1–18 This section consists of two competing invitations, one from wisdom and the other from folly. Both are portrayed as women calling people to enter their houses. Wisdom invites the simple to eat of her life-giving food (vv. 1–12). Folly offers food that leads to death (vv. 13–18).

rsbNotes.title: Pr 9:7–12
rsbNotes.text: 9:7–12 These verses contrast the wise and the fool, not only at the point of decision to enter the houses of wisdom or folly, but in the kind of lives that result from those decisions.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 9:11
rsbNotes.text: 9:11 See 3:2 and note.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 9:12
rsbNotes.text: 9:12 you are wise for yourself. That is, you will benefit (3:13–18; 4:9–13; 8:34, 35).
